summary: Experienced UI/UX Engineer with 8+ years of expertise in healthcare application design and development. Specializes in creating user-centered designs, wireframing, prototyping, and front-end implementation using modern technologies like React, Figma, and Tailwind CSS.

currentRole.title: UI/UX Engineer
responsibilities: Designing and developing user interfaces for healthcare management systems
Creating wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity designs
Conducting user research and usability testing
Implementing responsive designs with React and modern CSS frameworks
Collaborating with cross-functional teams including developers and product managers
Working with Kendo UI components for enterprise-level applications

careerHistory.title: UI/UX Engineer
careerHistory.description: Leading UI/UX design and development for healthcare applications

careerGoals.companyPreferences: Open to companies of all sizes - startups, scale-ups, and enterprises

highlights: Created intuitive patient attribution data displays

strengths: Strong balance of design and development skills
Ability to translate complex requirements into intuitive interfaces
Continuous learner and adaptable to new technologies

faqs.question: What makes you unique as a UI/UX Engineer?
faqs.answer: I bring a unique combination of strong design sensibility and technical implementation skills, with specialized expertise in healthcare applications. My 8-year journey from graphic design through front-end development to UI/UX engineering gives me a holistic understanding of the entire design-to-development process.

faqs.question: What is your experience with healthcare applications?
faqs.answer: I've been working on healthcare applications at Persivia since 2020, focusing on creating intuitive interfaces for complex medical data, patient management systems, and clinical workflows. I understand the importance of HIPAA compliance, accessibility, and designing for diverse user groups in healthcare settings.

faqs.question: Are you available for freelance or contract work?
faqs.answer: Yes! I'm open to freelance projects, contract work, and project-based collaborations. I'm particularly interested in UI/UX design projects, healthcare applications, and front-end development work.

faqs.question: What are your salary expectations?
faqs.answer: I prefer to discuss compensation based on the specific role, responsibilities, and company. I'm open to having that conversation during the interview process.

faqs.question: Can you work remotely?
faqs.answer: Absolutely! I'm comfortable with remote, hybrid, or on-site work arrangements. I have experience collaborating with distributed teams and have the setup needed for effective remote work.

faqs.question: What technologies are you currently learning?
faqs.answer: I'm actively expanding my skills in modern frontend frameworks, design systems, advanced Figma features, TypeScript, and exploring AI-assisted design tools. I believe in continuous learning to stay current with industry trends.

faqs.question: Do you have experience with design systems?
faqs.answer: Yes, I've worked with component libraries and design systems, particularly using Kendo UI for enterprise applications. I understand the importance of consistency, scalability, and maintainability in large-scale applications.

faqs.question: How can I contact you?
faqs.answer: You can reach me via email or connect with me on LinkedIn. My email and LinkedIn profile are available on my portfolio website at fahadmushtaq.com.

conversationStyle.approach: Clear, concise, and informative while maintaining warmth
